title.narrative: Musawat: Co funding Anna Lindh Foundation

description.narrative: 21 youth leaders from Lebanon, Iraq and Palestine as well as around 4000 peers.

Empower voices of youth leaders from Lebanon, Palestine and the Netherlands to counter discrimination based on Freedom of Religion and Belief through facilitating cultural exchanges and joint artistic or cultural collaborations. SO1: Develop shared understanding towards occurrence and need to counter discrimination on the basis of freedom of religion and belief among 21 youth leaders from Lebanon, Palestine and the Netherlands. SO2: Engage 21 youth leaders in promoting positive values and attitudes among their peers as a mean to counter discriminations on the basis of religion and belief

While Lebanon and the Occupied Palestinian Territories are in a region that is traditionally home to people from different religious and ethnic backgrounds, the Netherlands has also become a more diverse society through influx of immigrants and refugees. Similar dynamics are observed across the 3 countries as the diverse communities do not really live together. Segregation and lack of cross-community interactions create room for stereotypes and discrimination towards “the other”. The project will create opportunities for interaction and cross-border collaboration between youth leaders from the 3 countries to jointly address common root causes and manifestations of discrimination on the basis of religion and belief. Learning from each others’ realities and experiences, the youth will develop positive values and attitudes, such as understanding and acceptance. Voices of youth will be empowered by encouraging them to use artistic means to further disseminate positive messages among peers.
